pullRequest.body:
Introduce type class `BoundedSub`, which allows to generalize subtraction of `BoundedContinuousFunction` to the case where the values are not necessarily in `SeminormedAddGroup`. The most important case for measure theory applications that is allowed by the generalization is bounded continuous functions with values in `ℝ≥0`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

nodes.body:
This PR is a bit of a prototype for generalizing operations on bounded continuous functions. In particular, I will suggest that in a follow-up, a similar generalization is made to allow also multiplication of nonnegative bounded continuous functions.

(The chosen approach is making rather minimal changes to strictly generalize the operations on bounded continuous functions to a relevant case. An alternative less minimal change would involve refactoring the definition of `BoundedContinuousFunction` to use `Bornology` directly. Whether or not that is done in the future, the introduced type class seems necessary to me.)
